It is well established that if n is any integer then n + (n + 1) is an odd number."
" Example: "
"4 + 3 = 1"
" 7 + 6 = 11 or -7 + (-7 - 1) = -7 + (-8) = -15 "
" However, there is another way of generating a set of odd numbers and it goes as follows:"
" (n(n + n) - n)/n = (n(2n) - n)/n "
" = (2n2 - n)/n "

"

Example: If we choose 3 and substitute it into the formua above,"

" (2(32) - 3)/3 = 5 "

"

If we equate the 2 expressions above whic, each, generate a set of odd number we get: "
" (2n2 - n)/n = n + (n - 1) "
" Solving n:"
" (2n2 - n) = n(n + (n - 1))"
" (2n2 - n) = n(2n - 1))"
" (2n2 - n) = (2n2 - n)"
" The LHS is equal to the RHS as it can be seen.
